search.query: | inputlookup cs_tenable_vuln | stats max(_time) as _time, count, count(eval(vul_state="open" OR vul_state="reopened")) as active, count(eval(vul_state="fixed")) as fixed by tenable_uuid, vul_severity | stats max(_time) as _time, sum(count) as total_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="informational", count, 0))) as info_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="low", count, 0))) as low_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="medium", count, 0))) as medium_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="high", count, 0))) as high_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="critical", count, 0))) as critical_vuln, sum(active) as active_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="informational", active, 0))) as info_active_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="low", active, 0))) as low_active_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="medium", active, 0))) as medium_active_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="high", active, 0))) as high_active_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="critical", active, 0))) as critical_active_vuln, sum(fixed) as fixed_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="informational", fixed, 0))) as info_fixed_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="low", fixed, 0))) as low_fixed_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="medium", fixed, 0))) as medium_fixed_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="high", fixed, 0))) as high_fixed_vuln, sum(eval(if(vul_severity="critical", fixed, 0))) as critical_fixed_vuln by tenable_uuid | append [| inputlookup cs_tenable_inventory | rename hostname as host] | stats values(*) as *, max(time) as time by tenable_uuid | makemv ip delim="~~" | makemv host delim="~~" | makemv mac_address delim="~~" | rename time as tenable_last_event, created_at as tenable_created_at, first_seen as tenable_first_seen, last_seen as tenable_last_seen | fields - tenable_last_event, created_at, first_*, has_plugin_results | table tenable_uuid, ip, host, mac_address, tenable_os, tenable_state, total_vuln, active_vuln, critical_active_vuln, high_active_vuln, fixed_vuln, medium_active_vuln, low_active_vuln, info_active_vuln, last_seen, has_agent, tenable_network_name, tenable_fqdn, tenable_netbios, last_*, * | eval critical_active=if(critical_active=0, null(), critical_active), high_active=if(high_active=0, null(), high_active) | sort - active_vuln

html.p: Data Collection: Tenable data is necessary to collect the vulnerability scan results and host summaries. This data can be acquired via the Tenable Add-On for Splunk.
The data check for the table below is for the last seven days. The data for this table is loaded from the KV store lookup.

search.query: `cs_tenable` | stats count, latest(_time) as "Last Event" | eval data_report=if(count>0, "Data Present", "Data Not Present"), label="`cs_tenable`" | eval "Last Event"=if(count=0, " - ", strftime('Last Event', "%F %T")) | table label, "Last Event", data_report | append [| rest /servicesNS/-/cyences_app_for_splunk/saved/searches count=0 splunk_server=local | search "eai:acl.app"="cyences_app_for_splunk" title IN ("Device Inventory - Tenable", "Device Inventory - Tenable Vuln") | table title, disabled | rename title as label | eval data_report=if(disabled=1, "Report is disabled", "Report is enabled"), "Last Event"="N/A"] | table label, "Last Event", data_report

format.colorPalette: {"Data Present": #03991a, "Data Not Present": #a3030b, "Report is enabled": #03991a, "Report is disabled": #a3030b}
